instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boots, but freezes right at login screen
threads.message:
came in yesterday, customer spilt cocktail on it, wouldnt turn on at all.

After replacing SMC, <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, and a good clean w/ flux the board works again.
Computer boots up, but freezes on loginscreen, regardless of which SSD i put in (my own test-SSD as well)

Have read up a little on this forum, but its hard to measure anything when the board is in the case and it shuts down or freezes.

Have looked at the CPU Vcore mosfets, they did have some liquid damage so decided to replace all four of them (should i have replaced the <CHIP>U7310</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7320</CHIP> at the same time?
any other hints to what i could look for?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boots, but freezes right at login screen
threads.message: Could really be anything....Something around Vcore is very possible, but anything else is also possible. I know that is not what you wanted to hear....
